column4: hi, this is a bit off-topic, but i think this is the best place to ask: i was told that using irc without proxy is quite risky, because it exposes the own ip. so it is advisable to use a irc-proxy. so i want to know: is is necessary to get an irc-proxy, and if yes, do you know a trustworthy one?
i dont consider it risky.
if you want a 'cloak' to hide your ip - thats aviliable.
ive not used a proxy to irc in like... 20 years.. :)
this is what i read too. i was wondering if some1 allready tried it him/herself
one is for an encrypted home PARTITION i imagine.. the other is for the users to have their own encrypted HOME. (to protect from other users perhaps?)
ah, i forgot that also other users share the /home partition :P what you say is quite plausible. so now, my home floder is double encrypted Oo
use the package manager and remove the old kernels..
your suggestionis like the worse way :)
ubuntu-tweak has a little gui tool to do some cleanup also. I suggest leaving at least 2 kernels.

i don't understand why, for example, ubuntu opts to generate the grub.cfg instead of working on it directly... sometimes it makes things more complicated than they are.... anyways thank you for your hint about NOT removing these files from hand
idiot proofing and flexiablity..
the way the old grub  config/menu  was a combonation of both the grub config AND settings files for update-grub was much more confuiseing and problematic
so i have to remove the old kernel headeer packages?
never noticed. if you are remioving the old kernels.. that would make sence
can't follow you... are you speaking about removing the headers?
so can i safly remove the old kernel headers too?
sandhu let me hel you sandhu, i allready installed it
ive never seen the issue.. or heard of anyone else with the issue.
when you plug it in  check 'dmesg' output, near the bottom it should mentoon what /dev/sd# or /dev/sr# it is.
or try some other burning app like k3b, or gtoaster, or others
my dmesg output sees something http://pastebin.com/TXRTjdvy
